headline: Tasty Seasoned Oyster Crackers
description: Cool ranch seasoning and dill sets these quick seasoned crackers apart and makes them so perfect to crunch by the handful, use as a dipper, top a salad, or serve with a bowl of soup.
name: Tasty Seasoned Oyster Crackers

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).

In a large bowl, mix the canola oil, ranch dressing mix, dill, lemon pepper, granulated garlic, onion powder, seasoned salt, and white pepper until thoroughly combined. Gently mix the crackers with the seasonings, tossing to coat the crackers with the seasoned oil. Spread the crackers out onto a jelly roll pan in a single layer.

Bake in the preheated oven until the crackers are very lightly browned at the edges, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring to bake other sides halfway through cooking. Allow to cool completely before storing in airtight canister or resealable plastic bag.

review.reviewBody: Love these. Been making them for years, although we call them dilly crackers. Only things I change are I make them with goldfish crackers, and I double the dill.
Hot as firecrackers, ready to watch the Bengals win the Super Bowl!
Took this to the barn while we processed deer meat for the freezer. Everyone enjoyed these and I also added pretzels. Great beer drinking snack!
I substituted garlic salt for garlic powder. And omitted the pepper. Delicious!! Hubby canâ€™t keep his hands out of the jar!!

Great recipe! Admittedly, I switched it up and used Spicy Ranch seasoning, and because of that, I omitted all the pepper seasonings, dill and onion powder, kept everything else the same except for adding a bit of nutritional yeast to the final toss when it came out of the oven.
I liked this but I cut down the oil by a 1\4cup and didn't add the season salt at all the second time I made them because the first time they were just too oily and salty.
this is a very popular snack to have with friends. A little messy, but worth it. Make it all the time. Keeps at least 2 months if you can keep it that long.

Very tasty snack. Quick and Easy to make. My kids love them. They are great by themselves or as a salad topping. I love bold flavor so I heaped all my seasoning measurements. The bags of oyster crackers at our grocery were 12 oz. bags so that made the seasoning go a little further as well. I also went the full 20 minutes to have a nice crispiness but were not too done.
This snack is a quick, easy, low calorie, inexpensive snack, I took to a pot luck and now everyone wants the recipe
Great little snack. Something out of the ordinary.
These are the best ever! My friends and family beg for me to make more!!
These were really tasty but I probably won't serve them with soup again. A double batch is enough for the FOL group.

Just okay for me. I accidentally bought twice as many crackers as needed for our chili at Christmas, so needed to use some crackers. I appreciate the recipe, but did hit a couple of bumps. Followed the recipe except that I omitted the lemon pepper and seasoned salt. My picture shows a 12 x 17 and 10 x 15 pan with not quite two boxes of crackers...so...no way two boxes of crackers can be spread in a single layer onto a jelly roll pan, which I think is 10 x 15? Also, I baked these for forty minutes. They were more browned than they look in my picture...not the greatest photographer...but not that brown.
Awesome! LOVED these! I didn't use the lemon pepper - but otherwise ... everything was the same. Gave them out as gifts to neighbors. NUMMY!
I made two batches of these. The first was as written and was excellent, the second batch I add a half teaspoon of cayenne pepper. Those who like to kick it up a bit it added a little zip.
Delicious! Made exactly as written and would not change a thing...A definite keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
Love these. I added ground red pepper (1/4-1/2 tsp).
These are terrific! Better than every other oyster cracker recipe.!

I submitted this recipe. I wanted to note that due to additive allergies, I cannot use store-bought ranch dressing mix. So I use a mix recipe from here on AllRecipes. If you don't have store-bought, just make your own and then add the other ingredients. Then you don't get all of the additives.
Great flavor, easy to prepare, the kids love them. What more could one ask for?!
Yummy! The only thing I would do differently next time would be to cut down on the lemon pepper. It definitely adds to the overall flavor, but it was a little too prominent for my tastes. Thanks! :)

I used my own dry ranch dressing mix and I left out the seasoning salt, as I didn't want my crackers to be too salty. These turned out really good. I think they could use a little more spice but that's really a personal preferance. I made this with my oldest boy yesterday after dinner and so far, over half is gone! I think we'll be making this again real soon.
i make these every year for the holidays i put them in tins for Christmas presents they are very easy to make and so they are good
